author: Joe Queenan
title: How I Learned to Tolerate March Madness
text:
People can teach themselves to like just about anything. If you really put your mind to it, you can teach yourself to like broccoli or marzipan or “Cats” or Ed Sheeran—simply because you don’t want to feel cut off from everybody else who seems to be enjoying these things.
This is the way I feel about March Madness, the three-week NCAA tournament that began this week. I know that I can teach myself to get excited about college basketball. I know it.
...
